intro: Stenogyne sessilis, commonly known as the narrow-mouthed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds with silky hairs. Stenogyne sessilis plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native insects and birds.
